DPRK's Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Costa Rica 
    Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of Costa Rica for commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 was formed with due ceremony in San Jose on Feb. 8.
 The ceremony elected Jose Francisco Aguilar Bulgarelli, chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, chairman of the preparatory committee.
 The preparatory committee set a commemoration period from February to April and decided to widely introduce the greatness and undying exploits of the three generals of Mt. Paektu and organize different functions.

articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Published in Pakistan 
    Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in pamphlet by the Victorial Publishing House of Pakistan.
 The work published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997) clarifies the idea that maintaining the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction serves as fundamental principle to be observed to carry out the socialist cause and tasks and ways to do so.    
 The pamphlet in its preface noted that preserving the Juche character and national character and ensuring the independent development of the country and nation are prerequisite to strengthening the international unity and solidarity and making a genuine contribution to the development of the world revolutionary movement.
 An article of the pamphlet said that the work is of weighty importance in carving out the destiny of the people and independently building their country.

articles.title: Documentary Film "The Great Succession" Screened
New Year Friendly Gathering of Athletes of DPRK and Japan Held
articles.content:
Documentary Film "The Great Succession" Screened 
    Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Korean documentary film "The Great Succession" was screened at the People's Palace of Culture on Saturday. 
 Appreciating the film were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Jon Pyong Ho and Choe Thae Bok and other senior officials, members of the cabinet, officials of ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations and working people in the city.
 The film comprehensively deals with the revolutionary exploits leader Kim Jong Il has performed on the road of the sacred struggle for achieving the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, true to the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung.
 The film also deals with the undying ideological and theoretical exploits Kim Jong Il has performed by formulating the revolutionary idea of the President as an integral system of the ideas, theories and methods of Juche and thus glorifying it as the guiding idea in the present times and, at the same time, clarifying all the issues arising in the Party construction and activities and giving perfect answers to the theoretical and practical questions arising in all the fabrics of social life including politics, military affairs and economy.    
 It impressively tells about historical facts about how Kim Jong Il has strengthened the People's Army into the army of the Party and the revolution.
 The film shows officers and men of the People's Army devotedly defending the headquarters of the revolution and admirably performing their mission and duty as a driving force for building a great prosperous powerful nation.    
 The film deals with the great surge being effected in the socialist construction and the shining successes achieved in the field of literature and art under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who encouraged the popular masses to work astonishing miracles and perform feats by putting up the revolutionary slogans such as "Let us live our own way!" and "Let us all live and struggle like heroes!"

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Guyana
articles.content:
New Year Friendly Gathering of Athletes of DPRK and Japan Held 
    Tokyo, February 10 (KNS-KCNA) -- A friendly gathering of sportspersons of the DPRK and Japan for the new year 2006 was held in Tokyo on Feb. 3.
 Jong Won Hae, chairman of the Korean Amateur Athletes Federation in Japan, in a speech there said that last year the DPRK athletes made achievements in world championships and international games and promoted exchange, mutual understanding and friendship in the field of sports between the DPRK and Japan through several games held in Japan.
 Students of Korean schools under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan registered shining successes in several sports events including football, boxing and weightlifting to the joy of the Koreans in Japan.
 He underscored the need to channel greater efforts into the sports activities of students of Korean schools, make a positive contribution to producing ace players from Korean athletes in Japan who will represent the DPRK in the international area and, at the same time, conduct brisk exchange in the sports field between the two countries this year, too.

articles.title: Trans-world Tour Group in Defence of Tok Islet Kicks off in Seoul
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Guyana
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Guyanese preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 was formed with due ceremony in Georgetown on Feb. 3.
 At the ceremony Robert Williams, deputy mayor of Georgetown who is chairman of the Guyana National Committee for the Development of the Friendly Relations with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee set a commemoration period from February to April and decided to organize colorful functions and intensify activities for supporting the Korean people in their cause of national reunification in this period.

articles.title: February Holiday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Trans-world Tour Group in Defence of Tok Islet Kicks off in Seoul
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of kicking off a trans-world tour group for defending Tok Islet took place in Seoul on Tuesday, according to the south Korean KBS.
 At the ceremony students to travel the U.S. and European and Asian and other regions by motorcycles announced an action plan.    
 They said that they would hold seminars and conduct information service, etc. at over 20 universities in the U.S. and the European region to let them know that Tok Islet belongs to Korea. They added that they would visit media organizations of the U.S. and publishing houses of Canada and various other places to request them to correctly mark the islet.

articles.content:
Former Commander of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Condemned for His Reckless Remarks
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the Movement for Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces in south Korea on Feb. 5 issued a commentary castigating Laporte, former commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea, for palavering in his address when leaving office on Feb. 3 that the south Korea-U.S. alliance would undergo trials in the future and that those who advocate the alliance should clarify their stand.
 His remarks are not mere for an address on leaving his office, the commentary said, noting that they encourage pro-American bureaucrats sharing understanding with the U.S. and, at the same time, threaten the independent personnel.
 His remarks are, in essence, based on the U.S. basic mode of dominating south Korean society by division, said the commentary.

articles.title: Symposium on Art performance "Blue Sky over My Country"
Japan's Shameless Distortion of History in Textbooks Assailed
articles.content:
Symposium on Art performance "Blue Sky over My Country"
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A Juche-oriented literary and art symposium on art performance "Blue Sky over My Country" was held at the April 25 House of Culture on Thursday and Friday.
 Present there were Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song, Chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and the Arts of Korea Kim Jong Ho, officials concerned, officials of creation and guidance in the art field of the army and society, writers, artistes, teachers and students.    
 A reporter and speakers said at the symposium that the art performance is a declaration of music in the Songun era shaking the world and a demonstration of the might of Juche-based art breaking a new ground of human art in the 21st century.
 They stressed that the art performance, jointly created by writers and artistes of the Merited State Chorus of the Korean People's Army, the Mansudae Art Troupe, the Korean People's Army Song and Dance Ensemble, the Phibada Opera Troupe, the State National Art Troupe and other dignified art groups of the army and society, serves as an outstanding monumental masterpiece of the Songun era which gives a profound artistic depiction of the brilliant 60-year history of the glorious Workers' Party of Korea, the greatness of the Songun revolution and the invincible vitality of music politics.
 They noted that the art performance could be created and completed as a famous work of the Songun era entirely because leader Kim Jong Il wisely led the whole process of creating a large art work of unique concert form.    
 They called upon all officials, writers and artistes to bring about a new turn in creating art works in the same revolutionary fighting spirit that was displayed in the 1970s.
 Meanwhile, there were seminars on creation, rendition and stage decor and depiction.

articles.title: Poster for Kimjongilia Festival Published in DPRK
articles.content:
Japan's Shameless Distortion of History in Textbooks Assailed
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Japan's gross distortion of its history in textbooks is the most despicable and shameless criminal act of enraging the Korean people and other Asians, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a signed article.
 The article goes on:
 What is intolerable among other things is that the history textbooks of Japan cite "threat from the Korean Peninsula" that allegedly existed at that time in a bid to justify the Japanese imperialists' aggression and domination over Korea.
 The fiction of "threat from the Korean Peninsula" was, in essence, a brigandish theory of aggression asserting that Japan should occupy Korea and rule over it without fail for the "security" of Japan.    
 The above-said history textbooks grossly tampered with the history of the struggle waged by the Korean people to carry out reforms in the modern times. 
 Equally intolerable is the fact that the authors of those textbooks covered the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed by annexing Korea by force of arms and enforcing the harshest colonial rule over it and wrote that this "contributed to the modernization of Korea".    
 In the history textbooks the Japanese reactionaries totally falsified the truth behind the Japanese imperialists' annexation of Korea.    
 The worst thing done by them in distorting the history in textbooks is that their authors did not mention at all the most hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists such as massacres and forcible drafting of Koreans and plunder of natural resources of Korea, while whitewashing their crime-woven history of colonial rule over it. 
 What is particularly serious in Japan's retrogressive revision of its history textbooks is that their authors described Japan's wars of aggression as just.
 By educating the Japanese schoolchildren in the distorted history the Japanese authorities seek to imbue them with the militarist view of history and the idea of aggression and thus use them as a shock brigade for a war of aggression at any time.
 The above-said moves of the Japanese imperialists clearly reflect the social environment and process for the militarization under way in Japan at present where preparations for reinvasion of Korea are making rapid progress. 
 The Korean people are closely following the moves of the Japanese militarist forces to justify the history of the Japanese imperialists' past aggression of Korea.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Poster for Kimjongilia Festival Published in DPRK
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A poster for the 10th Kimjongilia Festival to be held on the occasion of February 16, the most auspicious holiday of the Korean nation, was published.
 Depicted on the poster are the majestic appearance of the Lake Chon on top of Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of the revolution, fireworks in the sky and red and beautiful Kimjongilia. It vividly shows that the birth of leader Kim Jong Il was a fortune for Juche Korea and a high honor for humankind and the sky over Korea will always remain clear and blue as it is blessed with the peerlessly illustrious commander born of Heaven who has defended and glorified the socialist country under the banner of Songun.    
 Printed on the upper part of the poster are letters "Celebration of February 16" and on its lower part words "The 10th Kimjongilia Festival" and the period of the festival.
